title: Top Bankruptcy Firm Kirkland Losing Lawyers as Economy Improves
sub_head: Up to 20 bankruptcy partners and associates left the firm this year
body:
Kirkland & Ellis LLP and several attorneys from the law firm’s dominant bankruptcy practice have parted ways amid a dramatic slowdown in corporate defaults and chapter 11 filings, according to people familiar with the matter.
Up to 20 partners and associates have left Kirkland’s roughly 200-lawyer bankruptcy practice this year, including junior partners who found out they wouldn’t be promoted to shareholder positions, the people said.
